title: (x) Oakland Tribune headline - Madison (Century 725) {Nicolai}
content:
!["of"](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002020im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41049.jpg)   
Can anyone help ID this font?   
I think it's some sort of Century but the 'f' isn't quite right.   
Thanks in advance!
author: sparkey1818

comments.content: Hmmm. Back from a meeting. The Bodoni poster I found isn't quite right. What era is the sample from?

Looks like you were close. I think that some of the Bodoni Bold Condensed type looks like this - old Mergenthaler Linotype & Monotype samples in the Jaspert Encyclopaedia of Type Faces look like this.   
   
Both have this odd hook on the f.

Hi. Thanks for all the leads! Here's another sample. It's from a current newspaper. I'll keep hunting.


violence.tif (42.6 k)
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002020im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/41105.jpg)

Still [Century 725](http://web.archive.org/web/20050525002020/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/century-725/bold/testdrive.html?s=weeks%2Bof%2Bcalm%2Bin%2BIraq&p=36) in my opinion... with tighter spacing and (maybe) slightly condensed   
Which newspaper is the sample taken from?

oakland tribune   
   
thanks, & i think we have a winner!
